summary.description: An nnU-Net basec model to segment liver from T1 weighted MRI scans

inputs.label: Input Image
inputs.description: The abdominal T1 weighted  MRI scan of a patient.

details.name: AIMI MRI Liver
details.type: nnU-Net (U-Net structure, optimized by data-driven heuristics)

publications.title: The AIMI Initiative: AI-Generated Annotations in IDC Collections

use.title: Intended Use
use.text: This model is intended to perform liver segmentation in T1 weighted MRI scans. The model has been trained and tested on scans aquired during clinical care of patients, so it might not be suited for a healthy population. The generalization capabilities of the model on a range of ages, genders, and ethnicities are unknown.

analyses.title: Quantitative Analyses
analyses.text: The model's performance was assessed using the Dice Coefficient and Normalized Surface Distance (NSD) with tolerance 7mm, as specified in the CT Liver segmentation task in the Medical Segmentation Decathlon challenge. The model was used to segment cases from the IDC collection TCGA-LIHC [1]. Seven of those cases were reviewed and corrected by a board-certified radiologist and a non-expert. The analysis is published here [2]

tables.label: Label-wise metrics (mean (standard deviation)) between AI derived and manually corrected MRI liver annotations

references.label: The AIMI Initiative: AI-Generated Annotations for Imaging Data Commons Collections

evaluation.title: Evaluation Data
evaluation.text: The model was used to segment cases from the IDC [1] collection TCGA-LIHC [1]. Seven of those cases were randomly selected to be reviewed and corrected by a board-certified radiologist. The model predictions, and radiologist corrections are published on zenodo [3]

references.label: Image segmentations produced by the AIMI Annotations initiative

training.title: Training Data
training.text: The training dataset consists of  350 MRI liver annotations taken from the AMOS [1] (N=40) and DUKE Liver Dataset V2 [2] (N=310).
